allOf().Description: Specifies a list of permission names that are all required. If specified, @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#anyOf_E@ and @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#value_E@ must both be null.

anyOf().Description: Specifies a list of permission names where at least one is required If specified, @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#allOf_E@ and @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#value_E@ must both be null.

conditional().Description: If true, the permission may not be required in all cases (e.g. it may only be enforced on certain platforms, or for certain call parameters, etc.

value().Description: The name of the permission that is required, if precisely one permission is required. If more than one permission is required, specify either @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#allOf_E@ or @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#anyOf_E@ instead. If specified, @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#anyOf_E@ and @B_android#support#annotation#RequiresPermission#allOf_E@ must both be null.

ClassDesc: Denotes that the annotated element requires (or may require) one or more permissions. Example of requiring a single permission: When specified on a parameter, the annotation indicates that the method requires a permission which depends on the value of the parameter. For example, consider android.app.Activity.startActivity(android.content.Intent):
